meanings.definition: The act of uprooting or overturning trees by the force of the wind.
meanings.sent1: The windthrow in the forest was so powerful that it uprooted many trees.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, the forest was filled with windthrow, showing the strength of the wind.
meanings.sent3: The windthrow in the woods played a game of tree dominos, causing a chaotic mess.
meanings.sent4: The windthrow in the park created a scene of nature's rebellion against human structures.
meanings.sent5: The windthrow left a trail of destruction, marking the path of the fierce wind.
